problem_text:
Let G be a finite group, p a prime number, and let |xG|p denote the maximum power of p that divides the class size of an element x ∈ G. Suppose that there exists a p-element g ∈ G such that |gG|p = maxx∈G |xG|p. Is it true that G has a normal p-complement?
A partial answer is in (https://arxiv.org/abs/1812.03641).
I. B. Gorshkov
answer: No, not necessarily, a counterexample is given by SmallGroup(192,945) (B. Sambale, Letter of 16 February 2022).
